comments.body: New libraries shall be "scoped": `libROOTDataFrame` (to avoid clashes like libRIO and lbRGL etc). Could you update the library name?
I think you may need to use `${ROOT_sqlite_FOUND}` or equivalent here and elsewhere.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@endif()

if(NOT sqlite)
  list(REMOVE_ITEM dictHeaders ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/inc/ROOT/RSqliteDS.hxx)
  list(REMOVE_ITEM sources ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/RSqliteDS.cxx)

comments.body: Shouldn't these be `PUBLIC` since `sqlite3.h` is included in `ROOT/RSqliteDS.hxx`, which is included by users? Same is probably true for the arrow equivalents above and maybe for `Davix::Davix` below if `davix.hpp` is included in a header users need.
The header of the sqlite data source is now changed such that it doesn't include `sqlite3.h` anymore. The arrow data source header didn't include anything special in the first place.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +102,106 @@  target_sources(ROOTDataFrame PRIVATE src/RSqliteDS.cxx)
  target_include_directories(ROOTDataFrame PRIVATE ${SQLITE_INCLUDE_DIR})
  target_link_libraries(ROOTDataFrame PRIVATE ${SQLITE_LIBRARIES})
  if (davix)
    target_link_libraries(ROOTDataFrame PRIVATE Davix::Davix)
